description.p: A human woman smiles unconcerned at several thugs surround her in a dark alley. She begins to chant softly and with a flash of light and smell of brimstone, a towering demon appears next to her. The thugs scatter but the summoned demon hunts them down to get vengeance for his mistress.

As trolls surround the defenseless elven village, eager for their dinner, a robed elf steps forward. The elven man mutters ancient words of magic to call forth primal spirits. Two large fiery elementals appear in front of the trolls. With perfect coordination, the elf commands the elementals to burn down the surprised enemies.

A group of dragon hunters fend off against a large black dragon. The dragon hunters are led by a radiant angel in splendid armor. Although the black dragon focuses on the celestial warrior, it fails to realize the lightly armored dwarf in the back, whose incantations shield the angel from the dragon’s attacks.

These mortals commanding fantastical guardians are summoners, mages who bond their souls with an eidolon, a creature from another planes. Summoners stunt their own magical progress to focus on the bond with their eidolon. Together, a summoner and their eidolon make a powerful team in and off the battlefield.

Unlike other mages or even conjuration wizards, a summoner spends most of their magical energy on perfecting their magical bond with their companion. Binding part of your soul to another creature is dangerous, so most summoners have a compelling reason for their practice. Some summoners feel a deep sense of isolation or loneliness that pushes them to search for friendship from beyond their world. Others have high ambitions but know they cannot achieve their aims alone, so they seek help from the outer planes.

A summoner is little without their bonded companion, their eidolon. The pair are shaped by their unique magical bond, and each eidolon is as unique as their summoner. Eidolons typically originate from other planes of existence such as demons from the Abyss or strange monstrosities from the Far Realm. Choosing your eidolon is an import step that is often influenced by your personal beliefs or desperation as fiends are eager to soul bond, but that kind of companionship is not for the faint hearted.

As you build your summoner, carefully consider three elements of your character’s background: Why do they seek summoning over more traditional magic, what eidolon do they bond with, and what is the nature of their relationship with their eidolon? Choosing between a fiendish eidolon or a celestial eidolon are two very different choices that are important to understanding your character’s motivations and drives.

Furthermore, how what is the nature of your summoner’s bond with its eidolon? Is it a friendly relationship where the pair are equal partners. Or does your summoner treat its eidolon as a slave and mere tool? How does the eidolon’s otherwordly influence shape your summoner? Binding part of your soul to a creature from the Far Realms is very different from bonding to an elemental.
You can make a summoner quickly by following these suggestions. First, your highest ability score should be Charisma, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the hermit background.
As a summoner, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d6 per summoner level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per summoner level after 1st
Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Charisma, Constitution
Skills: Choose two from Animal Handling, Arcana, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Nature, Persuasion, and Religion

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) two daggers (b) any simple weapon
(a) a priest’s pack or (b) a scholar’s pack
(a) set of leather armor

description.p: When you advance in level, and at your DM’s discretion, you may take the option to multiclass into a summoner. You must meet the following prerequisites to qualify for an summoner.
You need a 13 Charisma.
When you first multiclass into summoner, you gain only proficiency in simple weapons and light armor.

When determining spell slots, you add one half (rounded down) of your summoner levels to the levels of your other classes as described on page 164 of the Player’s Handbook. Use the resulting total to determine your spell slots by consulting the Multiclass Spellcaster table on page 165 of the Player’s Handbook.

setters.set: A class that summons a special companion.
When you first multiclass into summoner, you gain only proficiency in simple weapons and light armor.

description.p: At 1st level, you summon and form a strong bond with a planar creature called an eidolon. The type of creature and its statistics depend on your Bond Type, and you can only have one eidolon. By forming this bond, you link both your bodies and souls to one another. This bond can take the form of a unwilling bondage, contractual agreement, or a genuine friendship.

You can communicate telepathically with your eidolon and perceive through your eidolon’s senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Additionally, while perceiving through your eidolon’s senses, you can also speak through your eidolon in your own voice, even if your eidolon is normally incapable of speech.

You can dismiss your eidolon into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons as a bonus action. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. In combat, your eidolon moves and acts on your turn in initiative. If your eidolon is within 120 feet of you, you can verbally command the eidolon using your bonus action to move and take any of its actions listed in its statistics. If you do not issue a command to your eidolon, it takes the Dodge action. If you are incapacitated or absent, your companion does its best to protect you and itself from harm.
Your bond with your eidolon grants your eidolon a number of benefits while it is linked to you.

At first level, your eidolon’s hit points are equal to the maximum value of its hit die plus its Constitution modifier. Each time you gain a level in this class, your eidolon gains one additional hit die. Roll that hit die, add its Constitution modifier to the roll, and add the total to its hit point maximum. Alternatively, you can use the fixed value shown in your eidolon’s entry, which is the average result of the die roll (rounded up). During a short rest, your eidolon can regain hit points by expending its hit dice.

Whenever you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature of this class, your eidolon’s abilities also improve. You can increase one of its ability scores of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. If you play with the optional Feats rule, you can forgo increasing your eidolon’s ability scores to instead choose a feat of your choice for it. You can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Your eidolon has abilities and game statistics determined in part by your level. Your eidolon uses your proficiency bonus rather than its own. In addition to the areas where it normally uses its proficiency bonus, an eidolon also adds your proficiency bonus to its AC and to its damage rolls. Your eidolon gains proficiency in two skills of your choice. If a feature for your eidolon requires another creature to make a saving throw, the DC is equal to your spell save DC. Your eidolon can use magic items and even attune to magic items. Any item attuned to your eidolon counts against your limit of three attuned items.

If your eidolon is reduced to 0 hit points, it falls unconscious and makes death saving throws. When your eidolon dies, it is banished back to its pocket dimension. You can later restore your eidolon during a short rest. Your eidolon reappears in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you restored to maximum hit points but does not regain any expended hit dice. Restoring your eidolon multiple times a day is taxing on your body. If you restored your eidolon once already since your last long rest, then any further restoring makes you suffer a level of exhaustion.

Additionally, while perceiving through your eidolon’s senses, you can also speak through your eidolon in your own voice, even if your eidolon is normally incapable of speech. You can dismiss your eidolon into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons as a bonus action. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. In combat, your eidolon moves and acts on your turn in initiative. If your eidolon is within 120 feet of you, you can verbally command the eidolon using your bonus action to move and take any of its actions listed in its statistics. If you do not issue a command to your eidolon, it takes the Dodge action. If you are incapacitated or absent, your companion does its best to protect you and itself from harm.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you choose a type of bond that reflects your eidolon. You can choose one of the bonds detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 6th level and again at 10th, and 14th level. Those features also include Bond Spells.

By 1st, you have spent enough time with summoned magical beings to learn some magic to defend yourself and your eidolon. You learn two cantrips from the summoner spell list. See Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the swordmage spell list at the end of this document.

The Summoner table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your summoner spells. To cast one of your summoner spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of summoner spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the summoner spell list. When you do so, choose a number of summoner spells equal to your Charisma modifier + half your summoner level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of summoner spells requires time spent studying: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your summoner spells, since their magic reflects their connection to their eidolon. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a summoner spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your summoner spells.
See chapter 10 of the Player’s Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting.

When you reach 2nd level, you begin focusing your magic on enhancing your summoned companion and the bond you share. You gain two evolutions of your choice. Your evolutions options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain summoner levels, you gain additional invocations of your choice, as shown in the Evolutions Known column of the Summoner table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the evolutions you know and replace it with another evolution that you could learn at that level.

At 2nd level, you can siphon some of your magic to strengthen your eidolon. As part of your bonus action to command your eidolon, you can expend one spell slot to give your eidolon temporary hit points. The temporary hit points is 2d8 for a 1st level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.

sheet.description: As part of your bonus action to command your eidolon, you can expend one spell slot to give your eidolon temporary hit points. The temporary hit points is 2d8 for a 1st level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.

description.p: At 3rd level, you can use your eidolon as a conduit for your magic. When you cast a spell, your eidolon can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your eidolon must be within 60 feet of you. The spell save DC and any attack modifiers remains the same as if you had cast it. If you cast a concentration spell, you maintain the concentration, not your eidolon.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell, your eidolon can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your eidolon must be within 60 feet of you. If you cast a concentration spell, you maintain the concentration, not your eidolon.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

At 5th level, by focusing on your bond, your eidolon can strike more fiercely at the cost of your magic. You can use your bonus action to command your eidolon to make two attacks instead of one as normal. If you command your eidolon in this way, you can’t cast a spell during the same turn, except for a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.

sheet.description: You can command your eidolon to make two attacks instead of one as normal. If you command your eidolon in this way, you can’t cast a spell during the same turn, except for a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your eidolon’s attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: Your eidolon’s attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: When you reach 11th level, your bond has grown to the point that both of your life energies are merged together. As long as you and your eidolon are within 60 feet of each other, if one of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to split the damage. You and your eidolon each take half of the damage before resistances are applied.

sheet.description: As long as you and your eidolon are within 60 feet of each other, if one of you takes damage, you can split the damage. You and your eidolon each take half of the damage before resistances are applied.

description.p: At 15th level, you can rapidly renew your companion. If your eidolon is dead, you can use your action to restore it. Your eidolon appears in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you restored to maximum hit points. Restoring your eidolon in this way makes you suffer a level of exhaustion. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: If your eidolon is dead, you can restore it. Your eidolon appears in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you restored to maximum hit points. Restoring your eidolon in this way makes you suffer a level of exhaustion.

description.p: Starting at 20th level, as an action, you merge into your eidolon. While merged this way, you are protected from harm and cannot be the target of spells or effects. In this form, you and your eidolon share only one action, bonus action, and reaction. You use your eidolon’s saving throw proficiencies or yours, whichever is higher. You can cast spells while inside your eidolon and any material components used for these spells are taken from the your equipment, even though they are otherwise inaccessible.

This merged form lasts for 1 minute or until the eidolon is reduced to 0 hit points, which at that point you immediately appear in an unoccupied space adjacent to your eidolon. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You merge into your eidolon for up to 1 minute. While merged this way, you are protected from harm and cannot be the target of spells or effects. In this form, you and your eidolon share only one action, bonus action, and reaction.

description.p: You bind yourself to spirits from the elemental planes. Unlike other summoners, you control four elemental spirits that represent each elemental plane.
Medium Elemental, neutral
Armor Class: 12 + its Dexterity modifier + your proficiency modifier
Hit Die: 1d8 (5)
Speed: 30ft.
Saving Throws: proficient in Strength and Constitution saving throws
Resistances: eidolon’s damage type
Senses: darkvision 60 ft.
Languages: Primordial and can understand the language of its summoner
Slam. Melee Attack: + your proficiency bonus + its strength modifier to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 1d8 + its strength modifier bludgeoning damage.
At 1st level, your bond with your elemental eidolons brings you closer to nature. You can read, speak, and write Primordial. You gain proficiency with the Nature Skill.

Starting at 1st level, when you summon your eidolon, you can pick between four elements: air, earth, fire, or water. Each eidolon gains certain unique traits depending on its element. All of your eidolons share the same hit point pool. As an action, you can dismiss your current eidolon and resummon a different elemental eidolon.

tr.td: Fly speed equal to its movement speed
Sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet
Swim speed equal to its movement speed and can breathe water and air

sheet.description: When you summon your eidolon, you can pick between four elements: air, earth, fire, or water. As an action, you can dismiss your current eidolon and resummon a different elemental eidolon.

description.p: You gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are summoner spells for you.

td.em: commune with nature, wrath of nature

description.p: If your DM doesn’t allow UA content, you can substitute summon elemental spirit with conjure minor elemental.

At 6th level, you can use an action for your eidolon to explode enemies. Choose a point within 60 feet of your eidolon. All creatures within 10 feet of the point must make Dexterity saving throws or take damage equal to 2d10 + your summoner level. The damage type matches to your eidolon’s damage type.
Once you use this feature with one of your eidolons, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Choose a point within 60 feet of your eidolon. All creatures within 10 feet of the point must make Dexterity saving throws or take damage equal to 2d10 + {{level:summoner}}. The damage type matches to your eidolon’s damage type.

description.p: When you reach 10th level, your eidolons grow in strength. They gain the following benefits.

tr.td: Movement speed increases by 10 feet and movement cannot provoke opportunity attacks.
A creature hit by the eidolon’s slam attack succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Creatures that damage the eidolon with a melee attack take fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
The eidolon had advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to grapple or escape a grapple.

sheet.description: Your eidolon gains additional benefits.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use an action to unleash your eidolon’s elemental fury. The fury lasts for 1 minute and once you use this feature with one of your eidolons, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Air: Your eidolon creates a cyclone centered on itself that moves with your eidolon. The cyclone is a 10 feet radius and 40 feet tall. Any unrestrained creature that starts its turn in the cyclone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and is restrained. On a success, the creature takes half damage and is moved outside the cyclone’s space. A restrained creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. If successful, the creature is no longer restrained and is moved outside the cyclone’s space.

Earth: Your eidolon sends out earthquake tremors in a 30 feet aura. The area inside the aura is difficult terrain and any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Fire: Your eidolon radiates flames and super heats the ground in a 30 feet aura. The area inside the aura is difficult terrain and any creature that starts its turn in the aura must make on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 4d6 fire damage, and half damage on a success.

Water: Any creature within 10 feet of the eidolon must make Strength saving throws as the eidolon grows by two size categories to surround them in water. On a failure, a creature takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and is grappled (your spell save DC). Until the grapple ends, the creature is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. A grappled creature takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage at the start of its turn.

sheet.description: You unleash the elemental fury of your eidolon. Effects vary based on type you have summoned.

description.p: You summon and bind yourself to a celestial warrior of the upper planes. This heavenly warrior is a bastion of goodness, and pushes you to help others, defend the innocents, or punish the wicked.
At 1st level your bond with your heavenly eidolon enlightens you about the heavens. You can read, speak, and write Celestial. You gain proficiency with the Religion skill.

Starting at 1st level, your eidolon teaches you to be a fellow warrior of justice. You gain proficiency in medium armor, shields, and martial weapons. Your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
You gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are summoner spells for you.
If your DM doesn’t allow UA content, you can substitute summon celestial spirit with greater restoration.
When your reach 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 10th level, when you or a friendly creature are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of your eidolon, your eidolon can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing radiant light to flare before the attack hits or misses. An attacker that can’t be blinded is immune to this feature. If attack still hits, then the attacker must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn.
Your eidolon can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you or a friendly creature are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of your eidolon, your eidolon can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing radiant light to flare before the attack hits or misses. If attack still hits, then the attacker must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can spend your action for your eidolon to emit an aura of heavenly power. Your eidolon and all friendly creatures within 30 feet of your eidolon gain advantage on saving throws and add your Charisma modifier to weapon damage rolls.
The aura lasts for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can spend your action for your eidolon to emit an aura of heavenly power for 1 minute. Your eidolon and all friendly creatures within 30 feet of your eidolon gain advantage on saving throws and add {{charisma:modifier}} to weapon damage rolls.

description.p: You bind yourself to a fiend from the lower planes such as the Abyss or the Nine Hells. Depending on the type of fiend you summon, it might push you towards evil in different ways. However, these fiends can become strong allies in the heat of battle.
At 1st level your bond with your fiendish eidolon teaches you darker knowledge. You can read, speak, and write Abyssal or Infernal. You also gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill.

Beginning at 1st level, your eidolon can strike with fiendish fire. As an action, you empower your eidolon. Your eidolon’s next attack that hits before the end of your next turn deals additional 1d6 fire damage.
The damage increases at higher levels of this class to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at llth level, and 4d6 at 17th level.

sheet.description: Your eidolon’s next attack that hits before the end of your next turn deals additional {{fiery-claw:damage-dice}}d6 fire damage.

description.p: You gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are summoner spells for you.
description.h5: BOND WITH THE LOWER PLANES SPELLS

description.p: When your reach 6th level, you can use your action for your eidolon to terrify nearby enemies. All creatures within 10 feet of your eidolon must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is frightened of your eidolon until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: All creatures within 10 feet of your eidolon must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is frightened of your eidolon until the end of your next turn.

description.p: At 10th level, violence pushes your fiendish companion into a blood lust. When your eidolon scores a critical hit with a melee attack or reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it can use its reaction to move up to half its movement speed and make a Claw attack.

sheet.description: When your eidolon scores a critical hit with a melee attack or reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it can use its reaction to move up to half its movement speed and make a Claw attack.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can use your action for your eidolon to summon mortals souls from the underworld to grasp the living. All creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the eidolon must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d6 necrotic damage and is retrained for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half damage. A restrained creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC to no longer be restrained.

sheet.description: All creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the eidolon must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d6 necrotic damage and is retrained for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half damage.

description.p: You bind part of your soul to an entity from the Shadowfell, the dark echo of your own world. Your shadow eidolon might take the form of a shadowy beast, humanoid, or even dragon. The influence of the Shadowfell often changes you in noticeable ways such as your skin becoming paler, your skin icy to the touch, or light dimming around you.

At 1st level, your bond with your shadow eidolon imbues you with the magic of the Shadowfell. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 30 feet.

sheet.description: The range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your eidolon can disappear in the shadows. In dim light or darkness, you can use your action for your eidolon to take the Hide action even while being observed.

sheet.description: In dim light or darkness, you can use your action for your eidolon to take the Hide action even while being observed.

description.p: You gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are summoner spells for you.
If your DM doesn’t allow UA content, you can substitute summon shadow spirit with fear.

When you reach 6th level, you can use your action for your eidolon to use a foe’s shadow against themself. Choose a creature within 30 feet of your eidolon. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, the creature is restrained by its shadow for 1 minute and takes 4d6 necrotic damage. The restrained creature can make another Dexterity saving throw at the end of its turns to end the restrained effect.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Choose a creature within 30 feet of your eidolon. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, the creature is restrained by its shadow for 1 minute and takes 4d6 necrotic damage. The restrained creature can make another Dexterity saving throw at the end of its turns to end the restrained effect.

description.p: At 10th level, your shadow eidolon drains the life of fallen foes. When your eidolon reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it gains temporary hit points equal to your summoner level plus your Charisma modifier. It also gains advantage on its next attack roll.

sheet.description: When your eidolon reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it gains {{life-eater:temp-hp}} temporary hit. It also gains advantage on its next attack roll.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you can use your action to weaken the barrier between your world and the Shadowfell to empower your eidolon. Your eidolon grows to one size category larger, its attacks’ reach increases by 5 feet, and it gains resistance to all damage except radiant damage. Your eidolon’s attacks deal additional necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier. This empowerment lasts for 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Your eidolon grows to one size category larger for 1 minute, its attacks’ reach increases by 5 feet, and it gains resistance to all damage except radiant damage. Your eidolon’s attacks deal {{charisma:modifier}} additional necrotic damage.

description.p: You summon an otherwordly creature from the Far Realm that befuddles others but you can understand it with better clarity. Summoners that walk this patth are often nearly as insane as the aberrations they summon. The power of the Far Realms comes with a steep cost.

At 1st level your bond with your aberrant eidolon opens your mind to new possibilities. You can read, speak, and write Deep Speech. You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don’t need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic words, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

sheet.description: You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your eidolon’s blows can disrupt a foe’s mind. As an action, you empower your eidolon. Your eidolon’s next attack that hits before the end of your next turn also forces the hit creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, whenever the creature makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the end of your next turn, the creature must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

sheet.description: You empower your eidolon. Your eidolon’s next attack that hits before the end of your next turn also forces the hit creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, whenever the creature makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the end of your next turn, the creature must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

description.p: You gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are summoner spells for you.

td.em: evard’s black tentacles, summon aberrant spirit

description.p: If your DM doesn’t allow UA content, you can substitute summon aberrant spirit with confusion.

At 6th, you can use an action for your eidolon to psychically blast the mind of a nearby enemy. Choose a creature within 30 feet of your eidolon and the creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature is stunned for 1 minute. Your eidolon can also cast web as a 2nd level spell. When your eidolon casts web in this way, it is not affected by the spell. Your eidolon can’t cast this spell this way again until you finish a long rest.

Your eidolon can breathe elemental energy at your foes. When you choose this evolution, choose one of the following elements: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. Your eidolon can use its action to breathe that element in a 30 feet cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 6d6 damage of the chosen element, and on a success, a creature takes half damage. The damage increases to 8d6 at 11th level, and 10d6 at 17th level.
After your eidolon uses its breath weapon, it can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level

Your eidolon can shoot magical beams from its normal eyes or grows beholder like eye stalks. The eidolon can use its action to target a creature within 60 feet of it with one of its eye rays. Choose three of the following eye rays for your eidolon to have.

ul.li: Charm Ray: Target must succed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you and your eidolon for 1 minute, or until either of you or a friendly creature harms the targeted creature. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Paralyzing Ray: Target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Fear Ray: Target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Slow Ray: The targeted creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target’s speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can’t take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Sleep Ray: The targeted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

As an action, your eidolon can attempt to terrify nearby creatures. All creatures of your choosing within 30 feet of your eidolon must make a Wisdom saving throw. A targeted creature automatically succeeds on the save if it can’t hear or see your eidolon. On a failed save, a target becomes frightened of your eidolon for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once your eidolon uses this feature, your eidolon can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: Prerequisite: 15th level, Eye Rays
Your eidolon gains more powerful eye rays. Choose one of the following eye rays for your eidolon to add to its eye ray options.

ul.li: Telekinetic Ray: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or your eidolon moves it up to 30 ft. in any direction. It is restrained by the ray’s telekinetic grip until the start of the eidolon’s next turn or until the eidolon is incapacitated. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn’t being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 ft. in any direction. The eidolon can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

Petrification Ray: The targeted creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Disintegration Ray: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
Death Ray: The targeted creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.
